actions.text: Referred to House Committee on The Judiciary.
Referred to Subcommittee on Monopolies and Commercial Law.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Monopolies and Commercial Law

official_title: A joint resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States providing that, except in cases of national emergency, expenditures of the United States government in any fiscal year shall not exceed its revenues for that fiscal year.

summary.text: Constitutuional Amendment - Prohibits Federal expenditures in any fiscal year from exceeding its revenues for such fiscal year. Authorizes suspension of such prohibition in time of national emergency.

titles.title: A joint resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States providing that, except in cases of national emergency, expenditures of the United States government in any fiscal year shall not exceed its revenues for that fiscal year.
